Cardinal Families: We have some exciting news! The USDA has extended its FREE food program through December 31, 2020. This means that ALL breakfasts and ALL lunches are available to ALL students EVERY school day for FREE!

The USDA and federal food service program guidelines include complete meals only. Individual items, such as water, Gatorade or extra milk, will be charged. For example: If a student chooses to buy only milk, it will cost forty-five cents. However, if a student orders a full meal, milk is included and the entire meal is FREE for ALL students!

Sandy Valley Online Learning students may order and pick up FREE meals also. Pickup will be on Wednesdays from 4-6 p.m., at Door H11 (behind the high school). Online learning families can put their order in here: https://tinyurl.com/OnlineLearnFood.

We would still like parents to complete the free and reduced lunch applications for the 2020-21 school year as it helps with funding towards exciting initiatives such as this. The application can be found at svlocal.org.

Thank you and Go Cards!
